summary: This bill, the Public Utility Remediation and Enhancement for Water Act, amends the Federal Water Pollution Control Act. It directs the EPA to establish a grant program for publicly owned treatment works to address emerging contaminants like perfluoroalkyl and polyfluoroalkyl substances. The grants cover planning, design, and construction, as well as compliance with related standards. The federal share of the cost is at least 75%, and appropriations of $200,000,000 are authorized for fiscal years 2026-2028.
